moves.1. d4: A simple blitz showing a powerful attack.
moves.4... Bb4+ 5. c3 Ba5: Black managed to let his dsb out, but it will have no action against solid white pawns.
moves.7. g4: This is the reason of h3.
moves.7... O-O 8. e3: Opening the way for the Q.
moves.8... Ne4 9. h4: Necessary to free the Nf3 from the duty of guarding h4 from a BQ's incursion.
moves.9... f5: Understandable, but it just opens for me the g column.
moves.10. gxf5 exf5 11. Ng5 h6: Obviously, the idea never was NxN from my part.
moves.12. Qh5: Sac the N for the h column. Not a gimme, but...
moves.12... hxg5 13. hxg5 Nxg5: g6 would have been deadly for black.
moves.14. Bxg5 Qd6 15. c4: I already have the check, but it is not enough to crush black, so I look for other ways.
moves.15... Bxd2+: Riding off of the inactive B for a inactive N.
moves.17... dxc4: I have to accept black's counterattack, and try to go faster.
moves.19. Qh7+ Kf7 20. Qh5+ Kg8 21. Qh7+ Kf7 2: Looking for Bh5+, at the cost of...
moves.23... cxb3+ 24. Kd1: !? No check on the next move, that's all I need...
moves.24... bxa2: much better was b2, Rb1, Bxa2, but again, it gives me the needed tempo.
moves.25. Bh5+ Ke7 26. Bg5+ Kd7 27. Ke2: A risky plan, based on this: White's attack would be unstoppable if f5 falls. In order to provoke it, I need to get Be3 out of there. I just must be sure I won't be fried in the process. On the other side, I have to connect the Rooks or Qb1+ will crush me. In the following moves, my King will run as a rat, leaving a R en prise as a Trojan Gift...
moves.27... Bc4+ 28. Kf3 Bd5+ 29. Kg3: f4+, Bxf4 and nothing changes so much.
moves.29... Bxh1: If Qd6+, B or pawn f4.
moves.30. Qxf5+: Too much pressure and too uncordinated pieces, with a naked K. Mind: I'm -7.
moves.31. Qg6+: I saw this line. It is not the first that came to mind, but it forces mate. The longer line is the following.

gameName: As you like it... wild!, http://gameknot.com/
